title: Off to On-Chain Self Governance
description: Conflict resolution is difficult without an agreed upon history documented on blockchain.

f6_assessments.q0: This proposal might be implemented successfully based on the experience and plans of the proposing team, though I suggest more information be included within the proposal regarding the relevant experience of the proposers in managing initiatives of this nature, as well as a more detailed plan and budget for the task described.
f6_assessments.q1: For the community to be educated about the use of funds in a sustainable, reasonable, and practical manner, both the advantages and disadvantages may need to be stated more clearly.
f6_assessments.q2: This proposal has value, and its implementation would have great benefits. If technology improves over time, more thought might need to be given to verifying ROI. I understand we need to work with these changes but also identify the life cycle of each technology implementation and the returns.

f6_assessments.q0: Providing on-chain voting to project communities would be beneficial and could encourage meaningful participation, but I don't see how it would help to onboard new participants to Catalyst.
f6_assessments.q1: The team has a lot of relevant experience and are already working on the project. The plan is concise and the budget is reasonable.
f6_assessments.q2: The roadmap has clear goals and dates for each milestone. Achievable KPIs are listed in the proposal.

solution: Off2on chain voting mechanism resolves conflict for self governing communities on Cardano by creating immutable records of agreed decisions.
experience: Currently 5 active core members working since April. Backgrounds in product- & project management, editorial, philosophy & web development.
